guide.introduction: Weeding vinyl is much easier to do with a sharp tool. A utility knife works well in an individual setting, but may not be appropriate for a classroom. This tool is based on a pushpin and a pen or pen cap with tape. It is quick and easy to make, and very useful to have in your lab or Fab Lab classroom.
guide.introduction_rendered: Weeding vinyl is much easier to do with a sharp tool. A utility knife works well in an individual setting, but may not be appropriate for a classroom. This tool is based on a pushpin and a pen or pen cap with tape. It is quick and easy to make, and very useful to have in your lab or Fab Lab classroom.

lines.text: Simplest option: Put a push pin into a pen cap
lines.text_raw: Simplest option: Put a push pin into a pen cap

lines.text: Slightly more complex version: cut the back end off the push pin with the pliers and put the pin into the barrel of the pen.
lines.text_raw: Slightly more complex version: cut the back end off the push pin with the pliers and put the pin into the barrel of the pen.

lines.text: Secure the pin to the holder
lines.text_raw: Secure the pin to the holder

lines.text: On the pin, spear a piece of tape/vinyl that is about 1.5 inches square.
lines.text_raw: On the pin, spear a piece of tape/vinyl that is about 1.5 inches square.

lines.text: Cut slits on two sides of the piece. Fold the tape down so that it holds onto the sides of the holder. Do this to the other side of the tape.
lines.text_raw: Cut slits on two sides of the piece. Fold the tape down so that it holds onto the sides of the holder. Do this to the other side of the tape.

lines.text: Your picker or weeder is ready for use.
